docs.snippet: Uruguay captain Diego Lugano has been ruled out of the World Cup match against England on Thursday after a left knee strain intensified in recent days.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay captain Diego Lugano has been ruled out of the World Cup match against England on Thursday after a left knee strain intensified in recent days.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's captain and defender Diego Lugano will miss the World Cup Group D match against England on Thursday due to pain in his left knee, the Uruguayan football association said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's captain and defender Diego Lugano will miss the World Cup Group D match against England on Thursday due to pain in his left knee, the Uruguayan football association said.

docs.snippet: Shunning the flamboyance and individuality that has previously characterised their game, Costa Rica and their collection of nimble attacking talents face Italy on Friday ready to produce another World Cup shock.

docs.snippet: Slamming in goal after goal for Liverpool, Luis Suarez appeared to be reaching the peak of his game and ready to take the World Cup by storm. That's until the Uruguay striker felt pain in his left knee during the final match of the Premier League...
docs.lead_paragraph: Slamming in goal after goal for Liverpool, Luis Suarez appeared to be reaching the peak of his game and ready to take the World Cup by storm. That's until the Uruguay striker felt pain in his left knee during the final match of the Premier League season.

headline.main: Suarez Could Struggle to Recapture Form in Brazil

docs.snippet: Lawmakers in Luxembourg, whose prime minister is openly gay, overwhelmingly approved changes in the small European nation's legislation governing marriage on Wednesday that will allow people of the same sex to wed and to adopt children.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Luxembourg, whose prime minister is openly gay, overwhelmingly approved changes in the small European nation's legislation governing marriage on Wednesday that will allow people of the same sex to wed and to adopt children.

docs.snippet: At England's beachside hotel in Rio de Janeiro it was captain Steven Gerrard who tried to raise the spirits of his demoralized teammates. They hadn't been outplayed by Italy in their World Cup opener — far from it — but still go into...
docs.lead_paragraph: At England's beachside hotel in Rio de Janeiro it was captain Steven Gerrard who tried to raise the spirits of his demoralized teammates. They hadn't been outplayed by Italy in their World Cup opener — far from it — but still go into Thursday's game with Uruguay on zero points in Group D.

headline.main: While Upbeat, Gerrard Warns About Pain of Failure
headline.print_headline: While Upbeat, Gerrard Warns About Pain of Failure
